sections.section_instructions:
Choose the correct letter, A, B, C or D.

Write the correct letter in boxes 1-5 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: According to the writer, which marketing technique attempts to make consumers stay in a shop for longer?
The writer mentions bottled water in order to show that

options.A: Consumers buy it because of the fact that it is marketed.
options.B: People purchase it despite the fact that it has no taste.
options.C: Marketers need not do taste tests when a campaign is effective.
options.D: Tests prove that people cannot differentiate it from tap water.

questions.question_text: According to the writer, socially transmitted food preference occurs when

options.A: Only dominant members of an animal group influence what others eat.
options.B: The same types of animals naturally prefer the same types of food.
options.C: Animals are influenced by what any other animals of the same species eat.
options.D: A food type is more desirable because an animal views that food as scarce.

questions.question_text: According to the writer, how is learning by observation and imitation a useful feature of the brain?

options.B: Positive models can influence social behaviour.
options.C: It can give an advantage when communicating with others.
options.D: Cultural norms and relationships can be understood more easily.

questions.question_text: According to the writer, how does television advertising exploit the human tendency to imitate others?

options.A: It shows buying behaviour that marketers want to encourage in viewers.
options.B: It features people who have a desirable image.
options.C: It shows older people whom teenagers admire.
options.D: It features successful people endorsing products responsible for their success.

questions.question_text: The diamond campaign worked by making a connection in people's minds between diamonds and luxury.
People are more aware of visual marketing than auditory marketing.
The campaign advertising diamonds had a positive influence on society.
There is still some uncertainty about whether animals copy the behaviour of the most powerful animals among them.
Consumers make a logical connection between celebrities' achievements and the products they promote.

shared_options.A: People imitated behaviour that was linked with success.
shared_options.B: Younger animals of a certain species are more likely to imitate each other.
